content.title: Quail eggs are the most valuable dietary product. The effectiveness of the use of quail eggs in the diet of patients was known in ancient times. In this article, we will go into more detail about the health benefits of quail eggs, as well as share useful recipes.

content.text: Quail eggs weigh 10-12 grams, protected from above by a thin fragile shell, the color of which can vary. They contain more biologically active substances than eggs of other types of poultry. In addition, many people note that they taste better too.
Quail eggs are eaten baked, boiled, raw, fried and pickled. They are used in cooking to make omelets, scrambled eggs and mayonnaise, as well as to decorate salads or hot dishes.

The quail egg is a treasure trove of nutrients and therapeutic agents. Compared to a chicken egg , one gram of quail contains more vitamins: A - 2.5 times, B1 - 2.8 and B2 - 2.2 times. Quail eggs are a concentrated biological set of substances necessary for a person.

content.title: Reduce the risk of fatal diseases

content.text: If you have low potassium levels in your body, you run the risk of heart disease, high blood pressure, arthritis, stroke, cancer and indigestion. Eat quail eggs to keep your potassium levels normal.

Quail eggs are rich in iron. Iron is an essential mineral that not only boosts immunity, but also helps oxygenate your organs, tissues, and other parts of the body. Iron also stimulates the formation of red blood cells, which makes the blood healthier.
Quail eggs strengthen the body's immune system by ridding it of toxic compounds and metals that build up over time.

content.title: Prevents the formation of bladder stones

content.text: Quail eggs are good for the kidneys, liver and gallbladder. They are rich in lecithin, which helps break down bladder stones.
The nutrients in quail eggs straighten and strengthen the hair, leaving it shiny. If you want long, shiny and strong hair, consider including quail eggs in your diet.
Due to the unique set of micro- and macroelements, amino acids, lecithin, quail eggs are successfully used in cosmetology and dietetics.

content.perechen: In order to restore shine to overdried hair, you can use this recipe: beat a cup of olive oil, 5-6 quail eggs and a third of a cup of honey in a mixer. Lubricate the hair with the resulting mixture and use a comb to evenly distribute it over the entire head. After three hours, thoroughly rinse off the composition. Hair should be soft and shiny.

This mask nourishes and strengthens the hair: mix three quail eggs with 1 tablespoon of castor oil, add 4 drops of jojoba essential oil and 4 drops of rosemary essential oil. Castor oil can be substituted with almond, coconut, or jojoba oil.

content.text: Quail egg skin masks relieve puffiness, smooth wrinkles, and help restore healthy looking skin. Egg whites are good for oily skin, yolks are good for dry skin. Protein tones, dries, tightens flaccid skin, tightens pores. The yolk softens, nourishes the skin and makes it more elastic.

content.perechen: Mask for dry skin. Oat flour and 1 teaspoon of honey are added to the beaten yolks of three eggs. The gruel is applied to the face, after 15-20 minutes, it is washed off with warm water and a cold compress is made.
Mask for oily skin. Quail egg white, without beating, is applied to the face. As it dries, apply the next layer of protein. After 15-20 minutes, the mask is washed off with cool water.

content.text: The most valuable shell is quail. Medical studies have shown that quail eggshells, which are 90% calcium carbonate (calcium carbonate), are easily digestible. It contains all the trace elements necessary for the body: copper, fluorine, iron, manganese, molybdenum, phosphorus, sulfur, zinc, silicon and others - only 27 elements! Especially important is the significant content of silicon and molybdenum in it - our daily food is extremely poor in these elements, but they are absolutely necessary for the normal course of biochemical reactions in the body.

The introduction of crushed quail eggshells into food showed high therapeutic activity and the absence of any side effects, including bacterial contamination. Taking eggshells, you can not be afraid that the excess will be deposited on the bones and joints, do not be afraid of urolithiasis. If it is not needed, it is ideally excreted from the body.
By the way, the shell cleans water from chlorine and heavy metals, gives it alkaline properties, which prevents acidification of the body. Always be healthy eating quail eggs!
